description.narrative: This project falls under Solidaridad's Good Practices and Robust Infrastructure result areas and is rooted in Solidaridad's evolution from certification mechanisms and corporate interests, to beyond certification with a farmer focus. This evolution is the result of learnings from the FSP projects which revealed that farmers cannot be 'certified out of poverty', and which has become a driver of the MASP 2020. One of the key focuses of this strategy is to achieve speed and scale, which requires improving the economic performance of smallholder farmers. The Go Farmer app is being developed to facilitate this improved economic performance by giving smallholder farmers the tools, advice and guidance needed to evolve their farming into profitable businesses.

comment.narrative: The Go Farmer App will be piloted with cocoa farmers in Ghana.

Following the alpha release of farming Solution in July 2018 there have been some interesting observation from the 200 self registered farmers on the application. The most active feature to date is crop registration where 1,300 new crops and fields have been registered. This is consistent to anecdotal reports of farmers actively using the application to register and map their farms, because the app helps the farmers to calculate the area of their crops. A few farmers actively capture their financial records on the business solution system. By the end of 2018 these farmers had entered 600 income records and 500 cost records. Similarly the farmers had also recorded 500 activity records. As expected, the farmers provide the lowest response rates for creditor and debtor information where the system has 160 and 250 records respectively.
